title: Yaz覺l覺kaya (Hattusa)
description: A sacred rock-cut sanctuary of the Hittites. The sanctuary was in use from the late sixteenth century B.C. Many of the reliefs date to the reigns of Tudhaliya IV and Suppiluliuma II in the late thirteenth century B.C.

properties.description: A sacred rock-cut sanctuary of the Hittites. Location based on OpenStreetMap
properties.title: OSM location of Yaz覺l覺kaya
